website_summaries.verdict: Even with its much-publicized server problems resolved, the latest SimCity installment fails to excite or addict as much as previous games in the series.
pros: Introduces impressive algorithms for road design, sim tracking
New features simplify, expand traditional SimCity game play
Improved city reporting, tracking of statistics
cons: Many tweaks to core mechanics diminish entertainment, replay value
No functionality to play offline, or save or load games

customer_reviews.title: SimCity 2013 not good.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this title at release, but the online fiasco at release time is not biasing my opinion. I am writing this review a year and a half later. Some things about the interface are very nice, although some of these design choices are limiting too. The biggest criticism is that the Glassbox engine, supposedly based on the idea that each agent is represented, is flawed in execution if not in concept. A dedicated balanced RCI system has been abandoned for arbitrary and illogical rules. EA is taking far too much time fixing known bugs while continuing to introduce new ones.
customer_reviews.author: eRogue

customer_reviews.title: I so regret buying this game
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because: Sim City! I should have paid attention to the reviews. The DRM meant that if their servers were having trouble, I could not play my game, and since EA apparently way underestimated the number of servers they would need, I could not even play my game once it arrived at my home. Servers were always down or full, so I could not play the game for which I paid all that money. I will NEVER buy another EA game. EVER.

The game does get patches and improves slightly with each one, but I don't seeing this one being great. Not to mention the land you build on can get lonely due to people never joining it and issues with invites not working. EA's Origin console, which the game plays through just isn't good enough.

customer_reviews.title: Internet Hog
customer_reviews.text: Although the game may be the best thing since sliced bread, I never got a chance to play it. Because I connect to the internet via satellite (Wildblue's premier offering) because satellite is data transfer limited - the game forced me well over my 30 day limit of 17 gigs of data. If I had wireless or DSL, I'm sure the game would be fun to play, but with satellite - I can't play it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Douglas

customer_reviews.title: 0 Stars. Zero Stars. ZERO.
customer_reviews.text: "Server not available try again" "Server not available try again" "Server not available try again" "Server not available try again" "Server not available try again" There is your SimCity game right there. I have tried to connect for the whole day and have gotten to various stages of the "Server not available try again" game but have yet to play the game I purchased... Simcity. I have gotten the game to load, past the main menu, loading tutorial, tutorial city name appear on loading screen but have been stopped cold at every turn. Save your money and wait till EA buys a LOT more servers or modifies the ALWAYS online checking.
customer_reviews.author: P K

customer_reviews.title: Unplayable - literally
customer_reviews.text: EA ruined a great game by requiring a persistent connection to their servers. Problem is, they can't keep their servers running. They say try a different server if one server is busy. The problem with that is your cities dont sync across servers so if you connect to a different server you have to play a new/different city. That is crazy, trying to keep track of what cities are on what servers. And finally, when they decide to retire the servers, you are SOL. I wonder how many customers they have lost in their quest to defeat pirates. smh
customer_reviews.author: JLobb2

customer_reviews.title: I pre-ordered a game I can't play
customer_reviews.text: I give this game 1 star. Maxis forgot to follow the 7 Ps. Proper prior planning prevents piss poor performance. I get errors like; Server busy. Try again later. Please wait 28 minutes to play. Server connection time out. We are experiencing a problem, try again later. etc. etc. etc. I am very disappointed that in todays Online atmosphere this is the best Maxis can muster. I do not recommend this game and can only hope Maxis developers and management seriously question their decisions with the creation/testing/release/distribution of this game.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Basin

customer_reviews.title: This saddens me
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this game so badly. I have been a huge simcity fan dating back to the original game. The launch was abysmal, as everyone is well aware, however the patches arent making it much better. The traffic patch is an improvement but the AI is still horrid. Its looking like the DLC will be mostly corporate advertisements and out before the major fixes needed to make it playable. I havent written many reviews, and I really wanted this to be a positive one, but I just cant do it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy E. Cobb

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I have loved Sim City since the very first generation; this is horrible! A waste of my money and hopes. They need an offline mode for this game as a patch or something because the servers are always down and I have only been able to play this game for a total of 4 hours! I want my money back, but I am hoping that they create an offline mode for this game. $50 wasted to the Limited Edition should be Limited Play Edition. When I was able to play the game, it was awesome. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe31984

customer_reviews.title: Major Let Down.
customer_reviews.text: Mark me down with the other several thousand folks that are totally disappointed with this SIM City version. The maps are too small. Required constant Internet connection for a mostly single player game is insane. Just feel like a rip off. There are some good features - the presentation and graphics are very good.
customer_reviews.author: Wolford2129

customer_reviews.title: The "only online" play is a bad idea.
customer_reviews.text: This would be an acceptable game if playing offline was an option, but it isn't. What makes it worse is that you can't even play online due to EA's server malfunctions (gee, that's never happened before !!!). We're in the fourth day after launch and there's still problems logging on, saving games (it's only automatic and only when it works) and server loss in the middle of playing. For $50 bucks I could have gone to a few movies and had more fun. Fie upon EA and their mandatory online play.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not much of an attention holder.
customer_reviews.text: Can be a fun game, but does not hold your attention for a very long period of time. I had not experienced issues with the DRM like most say they had. The expansions for the game are far overpriced, and the game it's self without an expansion gets to be extremely bland. I really wanted to like this game. I really wanted to look past what everyone was saying about it, and enjoy it. But I just could not.
customer_reviews.author: Killerpancake01

customer_reviews.title: 60 bucks for a DRM laden coaster
customer_reviews.text: They have you install their mysterious Internet Tracking software and then the game doesnt even run. I lost my first 2 cities to their server crashes, and meanwhile they are trying to sell me upgrades to this Limited edition. Oh, and i havent been able to play it for the last 36 hours, because their servers are to busy. Oh and you need constant Internet access to play this game, since its all saved on their servers. Returning this product unfortunately, only when they remove the intrusive DRM features, I may rebuy.
customer_reviews.author: Saxafruge

customer_reviews.title: Even when it works it has flaws
customer_reviews.text: Based on roughly fifteen hours of game play (since release day) I can honestly say this is good game buried under a handful of significant flaws such as undersized cities, game saves tied to specific servers, and either incomprehensible or glitched mechanics for education and resource trading. These frustrating aspects, combined with the ongoing server issues, overwhelm an improved UI, nice graphical improvements and a more accessible game experience. The lack of an undo function and no way to reload a prior save should you change your mind can also prove incredibly frustrating. Many of these issues will most likely be addressed over time. Until then save your money and buy it later at the inevitable discounted price.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. B.

customer_reviews.title: ZERO
customer_reviews.text: I'd give it a zero if I could. Being a huge SimCity fan, I was thrilled to learn there was a new one. Unfortunately, it's always uploading, which takes forever. Then, when I do get the play option, servers are down or I get kicked out. Very sad. Very expensive game that sits on my computer unused. If I could return it, I would.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Hickey

customer_reviews.title: EA is the worst thing to happen to modern PC gaming
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes for Simcity as the ones in the past have been fantastic. Pre-ordered this in anticipation and started getting a little bit nervous over the "online only", origin required and so forth. Should have cancelled my order =/. Don't even let the servers being down steer you away. The online only system, no singleplayer (essentially) make this a beyond horrible game. It is NOT Simcity, this is EA's munged version tailored to their new model of online DRM (completely retarded, steam is a good example of what works, EA is just stupid). This will be the last EA game I will buy, I'm done. Worst point? Someone at EA thought this was a good idea. Idiots.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Appel

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy EA Games. DRM is honestly worthless.
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to play the game after receiving it 2 days after launch. Always-On DRM for a single player game with no local saves? Give me a break. This is the first EA product I've purchased in a long time and trust me: I will not be buying anymore EA games. Maxis: I'm very disappointing that you're letting EA ruin one of the greatest gaming franchises. For Shame.
customer_reviews.author: Bikran Sandhu

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: If you're going to force people to use your servers for gameplay... you'd better make sure your players can PLAY THE GAME. For real? If you sell x amount of games, the servers should support gameplay from that same amount of games being played... RIGHT? This game was a complete waste of money. I will never pre-order anything from EA again. I may not ever play another of their games again. I hope this makes them go down in flames.
customer_reviews.author: kthartline

customer_reviews.title: Two star game, -1 star for unplayable connection issues
customer_reviews.text: Everyone knows about the connection issues, but outside of that... this game sucks. SimCity 2000 was one of my favorite games, and the series went downhill from there. That being said, SimCity 4 is better than this...the online features RUIN the game. RUIN it. I can't even begin to describe to you how annoying this is - The system to help others in the region is stupid and annoying and makes me feel like i'm playing a facebook game. Seriously, this is like SimCity+ Facebook game. No fun at all, save your money.
customer_reviews.author: James Fleeting

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: Only thing that sucks is if you forget your origin account you have to buy the game again because the product code keeps it locked on that account even if you uninstall it unlike most other games
customer_reviews.author: Franklin

customer_reviews.title: lots of luck
customer_reviews.text: Every time i start the game to continue, you have to go through the stupid tutorial every time. getting a hold of origin is another matter. its like they don't want to hear from you. i've been trying over and over for weeks now, with no results. how do you get a hold of those guys. i love sim city but not this way, it isn't worth it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: If you like long lines and disbaled features this game is for you!
customer_reviews.text: To start this game has a lot of promise. I played a lot of Sim City 2000 and this brings back, and improves on what made that game great. If only the game worked. The always online features are broken. Your lucky if you can connect without having to wait twenty minutes for server access. You may be build half a new city then have the game crash erasing all of your work. Overall when you can play and the servers are stable it's a great game, but until they figure this out don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unable to load city at this time.
customer_reviews.text: "Unable to load city at this time." is the entirety of SimCity that I have been able to play at this point. Overall as loading screens go I'd rate it a 2/10. It gets the point across and is reasonably attractive, so it's not quite a 1, but other the other hand the music to the screen is obnoxious, the resolution doesn't match my screen resolution, so it's blurry, and it is of course inaccurate as it would be more accurate to say, "Our anti-piracy measures have ruined any chance of you actually playing the game you bought for the next few days at least." Yeah, definitely regretting my pre-order.
customer_reviews.author: Person

customer_reviews.title: Sad its only online...
customer_reviews.text: We should have the the only option to just play this game online. Whats even more scary is that this game is begining to look alot like an "expansion" game where in order to get other features (im sure like subways, highways, BIGGER cities etc) youll need to pay an extra $20 or $30. This has been done with The Sims 3. This game was never an RPG or MMORPG where you connect to a server and play with people competatively, in this case through leaderboards. Its a sandbox style city builder. I'd have more to say but i dont want to lose hope. Please bring back the single player option EA.
customer_reviews.author: George A.

customer_reviews.title: Worst SIMCITY version ever!
customer_reviews.text: This game is not worth it. You need internet connection to play it. You really don't have that much space to build. Roads don't eat your monthly budget. There is no subway and its hard to build rails in your city. Water don't last forever. You can't issue city ordinances. If you want to build a city, stick with SimCity 4.
customer_reviews.author: To be or Not To Be

customer_reviews.title: Unplayable at launch
customer_reviews.text: Huge disappointment. Installation was buggy and problematic. Now that it's installed, system rebooted, EA servers are down and the game cannot be played offline. What a waste of money. I expected a few glitches in a brand new game like this but I also expected to be able to play it. Electronic Arts should be giving refunds. The CONSTANT Internet connection requirement is just plain stupid. Forget playing on your flight, cruise, etc.
customer_reviews.author: GRM

customer_reviews.title: Instant Download is NOT Limited Edition.  DONT GET SCAMMED LIKE ME.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this expecting the limited edition, since it was on the page for the Limited Edition. I come to find out that this is only the basic version with no addons. So for $20, i bought a $10 game. I am very disappointed with Origin and Amazon. And of course since it was a download, I have no chance for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan M

customer_reviews.title: Very lackluster game...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not going to go into all the main gripes about the game with always on internet, etc. The main gripe would be the tiny a** cities you get to build. It's embarrassing... I've got a massively powerful PC and I don't have an option to make anything bigger than what I'd consider a very small city.
customer_reviews.author: MikeTrike

customer_reviews.title: You should go somewhere else for some fun.
customer_reviews.text: This game is entirely unplayable. Between the hassle of running origin, to wrestling with their servers, to reaching error after error because of outages or high latency. You simply cannot play it. It's broken- like a cheap vacuum cleaner. I thought it wouldn't happen to me because I'm on a 32 Megabit line, but it's on EA's side. It just doesn't work and you should probably spend your money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Bluesummers

customer_reviews.title: Forced Online Play Does Not Work.  Severe Server Issues
customer_reviews.text: This game requires online play, no option of playing it offline. The problem is that you can not connect to the servers. The launch was horrible and there is no customer support. I have had the game for 2 days and still unable to play it. You are not able to get online through their servers to begin the game. I would advise not purchasing this game. I will be getting a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Mccluskey

customer_reviews.title: Unplayable
customer_reviews.text: I have never left a review on Amazon before, but this product is so dreadful I felt compelled to write a negative review. With today's technology and cloud computing, it is unfathomable for EA's inability to simply spin up more servers to handle the server load. With much anticipation for this game, I have yet to play a single minute of this game. Thankfully, Blizzard's Heart of the Swarm will be coming out next week and I can ditch this dreadful product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Y.

customer_reviews.title: What hapened to purchasing games?
customer_reviews.text: When I was younger, you purchased a game, installed a game and played a game. Not with this one! Even though you get a disk, the game requires a constant internet connection, even if you want to play one player. The serves have been overloaded since the launch. I will read boxes more carefully from now on. I will refuse to purchase any game with this requirement going forward.
customer_reviews.author: J. Breuer

customer_reviews.title: Playing the game is dependent upon servers that do not function properly
customer_reviews.text: The server that enable the game play do not function properly. I, along with others it appears, have handed over money for a software title that fails to deliver a functional product. EA Inc. really failed and I cannot help but hope that investors and the EA Board of Directors take some punitive actions on the executive members for such a clear demonstration of failed product management.
customer_reviews.author: DSB

customer_reviews.title: EA owes me $60
customer_reviews.text: Thought I would give EA the benefit of the doubt (after reading about SimCity from others prior to release) and bought this game. Should have listened. Instead of actually being able to play SimCity right now, I'm here writing a review about how much their online only DRM sucks. EA, please get rid of your required internet connection (b/c I know you won't fix your servers). Don't get me wrong, SimCity 5 is a great game to play, IF and when you can play it. EA, listen to your customers! Fix this nonsense and release a new version without this horrible online only requirement. This has been such a disappointment and a waste of $60.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Fennell

customer_reviews.title: Poor simulation.
customer_reviews.text: The traffic, even after the update, is a poor reflection of real traffic. As a result, massive congestion occurs in small towns even when all the streets are downtown new york grade. This, plus numerous other problems a quick google search would reveal, is reason enough to look elsewhere for simulation needs.
customer_reviews.author: Black Fox Book Review

customer_reviews.title: RETURNED. If I could I'd rate it 0 stars!
customer_reviews.text: DON'T waste your money on this game, I preordered, and was really looking forward to playing. I cannot even install due to EA's awful servers and the requirement that I have to be connected to a server at all times to play. I would have not ordered in the first place if Amazon's description was accurate, it does not state constant internet connection, only internet required. That being said Amazon gets 5 stars for refunding my purchase price for this piece of trash. EA I will never preorder a game you make again.
customer_reviews.author: LRCJC

customer_reviews.title: Game unplayable
customer_reviews.text: 1) North American servers are full 2) I can't create my own region on any other servers 3) I was able to create my own city in someone else's region 4) The game crashed shortly afterward 5) I reload the game and then it decides i need to play the tutorial 6) The tutorial level loads, but the tutorial never starts 7) I am stuck in limbo because i can't even play the tutorial and it is a requirement to play the rest of the game now. I really did expect to buy my game and play it on launch day. In the world of cloud computing is that just too much to ask anymore?
customer_reviews.author: David Braud

customer_reviews.title: I wish Amazon took video game returns.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed. I spent about 2 hours trying to play this game. Either I couldn't connect to their servers or, once connected, none of the controls in the game worked. I could scroll around and look at a city but I couldn't actually do anything. This is awful, especially for what is supposed to be a single player game. I should have just loaded up the original on my old Amiga. At least that one still works. (which you won't be able to say about this steaming pile in 20 years).
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Norton

customer_reviews.title: We must be lucky
customer_reviews.text: We have not had any of the server problems we keep hearing about but I have no idea why. My wife especially loves this game and she doesn't play many games. The one down side for us is the small size of the cities. You can't make the super mega sized cities you could in the past. Instead you end up creating multiple cities and having them support eachother. This is still an awesome game, I just miss having the really big areas to spread across.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Even with all the bugs gone...its just not engaging over the long run.
customer_reviews.text: This game was doomed from beginning to end for me. Server problems and ridiculous DRM made the game a joke. However, even when it was all fixed (sorta), the game didn't keep me engaged. It just bored me. I will say that the graphics were cool early on but even that wears off pretty fast.
customer_reviews.author: N. Calhoun

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed fan
customer_reviews.text: I've enjoyed the SimCity series since SC2000 and was looking forward to this game. After the initial novelty, the game soon shows how shallow the simulation is and how many issues there really are. Initially I wanted to recommend purchasing the game sometime in the near future when the bugs are finally ironed out. Now I'd like to tell everyone to avoid this product completely. The fact that EA would be willing to release a game so broken speaks volumes about the ethics of the company. Not only has a SimCity fan been disappointed, but an EA hater has also been born. Here's hoping for their demise.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Good game when it works
customer_reviews.text: A pretty fun game when you can get online to play. I am disappointed with map sizes, region sizes, always online requirement and the lack of transportation options. Perhaps the biggest flaw is the always online requirement, especially since you cannot migrate your cities between servers (once you start on one you are stuck with it, so if it's down you either can't play or you have to start a new city on a new server). It is pretty fun but seems like a step backwards from SC4.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Gets boring, traffic kills fun
customer_reviews.text: The game is great at first, but quickly gets boring once you max your city size out. The traffic issues stop you from getting over 400,000 population and the online aspect doesn't play out the way they advertise. The seller is good, purchase went through timely and correct! Just the game may not be worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew Brunetta

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't work
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't log into an account for the game and thus it would not install on my PC.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Spilker

customer_reviews.title: EA DRM broke Simcity
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to revisiting a classic pc game, instead I found a beta copy of a game where you must use Origin and be online to play. Meanwhile none of the EA servers work. So the game is unoperable. I was unable to play the tutorial. I was unable to play a city. When I uninstalled the game indicated I had played for one hour. That was an hour I did nothing but try to log in to play this broken awful game by EA. To Amazon's credit they have accepted my return of the open DVD and promise a full refund. Maybe I will revisit this game when its in the bargin bin
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: The game is awesome when I can actually connect to play.
customer_reviews.text: Epic fail EA and Origin. The game is awesome, but like soo many others I have only been able to play for a few minutes due to the downtime of the remote servers needed to play this game. If you are going to require a constant internet connection to play a game, at least give the people who purchased your title some respect and manage your server farm better, this totally ruined the experience. EA, you just made the list.
customer_reviews.author: R.P.M,

customer_reviews.title: Fundamentally Broken
customer_reviews.text: The core engine, the traffic, the highway system, the fixed regions, the advertising, and the "rushed" feel of this product delivers a giant black eye to the series. EA's "selection" of free games as an apology is a joke. Maxis should be ashamed, Will Wright should be ashamed, and EA has no shame. Save your money, or use it on any of the independent games and kick-starter games. Also, in order to "win" in this "Sim" set your taxes to zero, build no services, and watch as people, commerce, and industry still flood your city to max density. Fail.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Scolamiero

customer_reviews.title: It's a joke.
customer_reviews.text: This game was no where close to being ready for release. #1 Servers don't stay online for more than a few minutes at a time. #2 Graphics look like they are from the 90's. I expected something much better. #3 You can't play off-line which is a real issue since EA can't keep the servers on-line. Don't reward EA by buying this game like the rest of us did.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: When I heard SimCity was being released I was extremely excited. That excitement for the a new release of the franchise blinded me, so I didn't research the DRM function of the game. I received the game the on day of release and still have not been able to log onto the game to play. From what I'm reading from others I rather not play the game until they get the servers under control, so I don't waste time building a city that may not be there the next time I log on. Don't waste your money until EA gets their S*** together.
customer_reviews.author: The Slenkers

customer_reviews.title: If only it would work
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited for simcity. I have been a SimCity fan for years starting all the way back to the very first one. I wish I could rate this game and tell you how it is......The problem is, I can't play it!!! The server is constantly down and I have yet to play and build one city. I have had the game for several days and still no luck. I hope they resolve this soon. I would not purchase this for the time being. Why would anyone if they won't be able to play.
customer_reviews.author: Franco

customer_reviews.title: I would love to be able to provide a review of the GAMEPLAY...
customer_reviews.text: But every time I try to "claim" a city, I get an error message "Unable to create your city at this time. Please try to claim a city again later.", if it's not that, then I simply can't log in to the server. It makes no sense for a city building game to force you to play online. We should be able to play offline if we want.
customer_reviews.author: TMS79

product_meta.title: SimCity: Limited Edition by Electronic Arts
product_meta.description: The defining city simulation is back! Create the city you desire and make the choices that shape your city and power the Sims within it. Every decision, big or small, has real consequences. Invest in heavy industry and your economy will soar - but at the expense of your Sims' health as pollution spreads. Implement green technology and improve your Sims’ lives while risking higher taxes and unemployment. Team up with your friends to solve global challenges: launch a space shuttle, reduce carbon emissions, or build magnificent wonders. Compete on global and regional leaderboards to be the richest, the dirtiest, the happiest or the best place to visit!
feature_bullets: Constructible Worlds - Creative and customizable world that offers unique gameplay benefits, all with a fun tactile interface
Sims Matter - The Sims in your city speak to you directly and it's up to you to respond to their needs. Will you listen and be the toast of the town? Or abuse your power for fame and fortune?
Specialize in What You Love - Mold your city as a casino resort, manufacturing hub, educational enclave, and more, and then watch as a unique look and feel spread throughout your city
Multiplayer - Build a region with friends for the first time! Collaborate or compete in regional and global challenges and make decisions that impact the greater SimCity World

GlassBox Engine - SimCity introduces GlassBox, the revolutionary simulation technology that gives you the power to impact individual Sims lives, manage city level simulation, and balance multiple city simulations at once
